author: travelandtourworld.com
title: China Southern Airlines launch service to Nairobi - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
China Southern Airlines launch service to Nairobi Published on : Thursday, August 6, 2015
China Southern Airlines, one of China’s “Big Three” carriers, has launched its service to Nairobi, with the inaugural flight from Guangzhou in southern China touching down at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport in the Kenyan capital on Wednesday.
The Kenya Tourism Board is banking on the new Guangzhou-Nairobi service by the world’s sixth largest airline in terms of passengers carried to boost arrivals from Asia. Its Managing Director, Muriithi Ndegwa, said the airline and the local tourism marketing agency would sign a joint tourism marketing deal to promote inbound tourism to Kenya.
The airline will initially have three weekly flights under a code-share agreement with Kenya Airways.
Tourism stakeholders here are banking on China Southern to spark an increase in tourist arrivals from China, one of the fastest growing tourism outbound markets with about 110 million Chinese tourists visiting other countries annually.
China Southern will code-share its service with Kenya Airways to provide 20 flights per week on the new Nairobi-Guangzhou route and both airlines say this arrangement will help drive growth for both.
China Southern is targeting local travellers who import products from China, tourists visiting the two countries as well as students on exchange programmes.
